intro: Anisotoma mollis, commonly known as the silky anisotome, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silvery-green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique foliage and vibrant blooms make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Anisotoma mollis is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
